children.name: HVAC

children.name: Engineering Substantiation

children.name: Packages and Containers

children.name: Pressure Systems

children.name: Valves, SRV's, control, isolation
children.description: Design or specify a manual or actuated valve suitable for the given process conditions and for the required duties

children.name: Fluid Systems
children.description: Design of fluid power systems(hydraulics and pneumatics) that use fluids under pressure to generate, control, and transmit power

children.name: Fluidic Devices
children.description: Design or specification of fluidic devices (pumps, mixers, valves and samplers) where it is important for there to be no moving parts in contact with the material being handled

children.description: Apply Non-Destructive Testing techniques in order to substantiate or modify mechanical design of equipment

children.name: Solids & Structures inc Structural Analysis

children.name: Radiological Contamination

children.name: Interlocks

children.name: Safety Management Prospectus
children.description: Provide advice or guidance on content of the SMP, including updating of organisation, resources  and management systems so that licensee is able to demonstrate continuing licensability throughout the lifecycle of the site

children.name: Safety Assessment Management
children.description: Produce safety cases and periodic reviews as required by licence conditions, Safety Assessment Principles (SAP) and relevant TAGs in order to confirm that the total current safety case for an installation remains adequate, or to update and revalidate it as appropriate

children.name: Intelligent Customer
children.description: Provide technical, operational or managerial oversight for work carried out on behalf of the licenced sitefacility by contract staff and external suppliers, in order to retain control of the safety case

children.name: Management of Change
children.description: Provide rigorous systems for the formal management of change in order to remove the risk of unauthorised modifications This includes control of design changes to the plant including classification of modification, impact on safety case claims, appropriate scrutiny and approval of change

children.name: Nuclear Baseline
children.description: Provide the content of a Nuclear Baseline in order to demonstrate organisational structure, staffing and competencies are, and will remain, suitable and sufficient to manage nuclear safety throughout the full range of the licenseeâ€™s business

children.name: Quality Assurance
children.description: Provide a QA system as related to the management of nuclear safety and for the whole lifecycle of the assets in order to minimise the occurrence of safety non-conformances

children.name: Records Management
children.description: Implement an effective records management system relating to nuclear safety in order to satisfy the requirements for identification, production, amendment, storage and disposal of nuclear safety records

children.name: Review and Audit
children.description: Review and audit the performance of the safety management system, including outcomes of audits, compliance against measurable standards and deficiencies in work practices Highlight best practice and recommend improvements

children.name: Safety Case Author
children.description: Author safety cases for new or existing facilities, for risk categories up to Cat 1 (AWE Cat 5) and at each stage in the lifecycle

children.name: Independent Peer Review
children.description: Provide an independent review of safety case documentation, process and its context

children.name: Assessment Methods
children.description: Select and apply the appropriate safety assessment method (deterministicprobabilistic) in order to identify hazards and determine their impact

children.name: Internalexternal hazards
children.description: Provide differentiated safety assessments for each of (1) plant based faults eg loss of coolant (2) internal hazards eg steam release and (3) external hazards eg climate change, flooding, earthquakes Manage them ALARP

children.name: Engineering Schedule
children.description: Generate engineering schedules and manage the integration of engineering substantiation into the safety case, including derivation of SFRs, performance requirements, categorisation of systems as required

children.name: Fault schedule
children.description: Generate fault schedules from hazard identification information Use, manage and maintain fault schedules in the context of a PSA

children.name: Optioneering
children.description: Provide an appraisal of alternative design options at the early project stage, in order to ensure and demonstrate that solutions are ALARP

children.name: ALARP
children.description: Provide measures available for minimising risk, consistent with the cost associated with the benefit derived from that measure (in terms of time, effort and money)not being grossly disproportionate to the level of risk averted

children.name: FMEA
children.description: Carry out Failure Modes and Effect Analyses at plant, systems and equipment levels in order to identify potential failure mechanisms and then reduce the effect by reducing severity of failure mode andor lowering the likelihood of failure

children.name: HAZCON
children.description: Carry out HAZCON (Hazards in Construction) study in order to systematically and formally identify and assess the risks which may be present during construction of an asset and as fulfilment of responsibilities under CDM regulations

children.name: HAZOP
children.description: Carry out a hazard and operability study (HAZOP) as part of a multi-disciplinary team and on a planned or existing process in order to identify and evaluate problems that may represent risks to personnel or equipment, or prevent efficient operation

children.name: Plant Walkdowns
children.description: Carry out methodical, on-site and visual inspections of installed plant and equipment throughout its life cycle in order to identify hazards resulting from degraded conditions

children.name: SWIFT
children.description: Carry out a Structured What-If (SWIFT) study or similar system based, structured brainstorming techniques in order to identify preliminary risk areas

children.name: Reliability
children.description: Generate reliability models based on reliability data such as failure rate, mission time and test interval Manipulate data according to standard reliability techniques

children.name: Event Tree Analysis
children.description: Use event trees to model plant responses to initiating events

children.name: Fault Tree Analysis
children.description: Use fault trees to model plant systems in detail and identify the combinations of failures that cause the overall system to fail and determine the overall failure probability Identify common mode failures and high integrityredundant system solutions

children.name: HRA
children.description: Carry out Human reliability analysis (HRA) in order to evaluate human errors that are important to the outcome of an event Assess the probability of a mistake in light of factors such as training, procedures, and expected conditions during an event

children.name: PSA Results
children.description: Perform PSA using Monte Carlo and other methods to compute the risks Test sensitivity of results to variations in each factor of the analysis, imperfect knowledge, as well as factor interaction

children.name: Assessments
children.description: Analyse normal and abnormal fissile material operations and provide controls on the processing of fissile materials in order to minimise the probability of a nuclear criticality accident Analyses include robust criticality arguments, double contingency approach and CIDAS omission justifications Controls include inherently safe, fault-tolerant designs and administrative procedures

children.name: Fissile materials and criticality factors
children.description: Apply an understanding of fissile material behaviour and the factors that can lead to criticality in order to prevent inadvertent, self-sustaining nuclear chain reactions for operations involving fissile isotopes

children.name: Codes and Standards
children.description: Apply relevant computer programmes (eg MONK and MCNP) in order to model a system containing fissile material and determine with given assumptions whether it is safe

children.name: Shielding codes and programs
children.description: Use computer shielding codes (MCNP, MicroShield, RANKERN etc) and analytical techniques to model complex shielding problems including radiation scattering and then determine shielding requirements

children.name: Dose Assessments
children.description: Produce direct radiation dose assessments and liaise with design teams to procure occupancy data and  iteratively refine designs and input data to minimise dose accrual

children.name: Dose minimisation ALARP reviews
children.description: Produce ALARP arguments to justify dose accruals

children.name: Radiological Area Classification
children.description: Apply R zoning criteria and assign R zones Liaise with Health Physics and Nuclear Containment (HVAC) functions to develop a C zoning schemes

children.name: Shielding design and substantiation
children.description: Provide generic design advice, bespoke shielding design solutions or shielding substantiation, all subject to design and practical and ALARP constraints

children.name: Radiation Physics
children.description: Apply fundamentals of radiation physics to shielding problems in order to underpin computer model results and give confidence in calculated results

children.name: Emergency Plan Content
children.description: Formulate emergency arrangements into an overall plan that provides effective action at all stages of a nuclear emergency in order that the emergency is brought under control and the site is brought to a safe condition The plan fulfils the requirements of Licence Condition 11 and REPPIR

children.name: Level 1 on-site assessments
children.description: Assess requirements and provide arrangements for the management of on-site emergencies and exercises

children.name: Level 2 off-site assessments
children.description: Assess requirements and provide arrangements for the management of off-site emergencies including exercises and interfaces with local authorities

children.name: Performance Assessment
children.description: Review the effectiveness of existing emergency arrangements and identify improvement areas

children.name: Application of ALARP
children.description: Apply ALARP principles to the risk assessment and implementation of engineered and operational dose control systems

children.name: Detection and Measurement
children.description: Design or specify the appropriate technology andor equipment required for the detection and measurement of radiation doses Provide limitations, features, costbenefits for alternatives

children.name: Dosimetry
children.description: Apply an understanding of internal and external dosimetry in an operational context to the management of radiological protection within nuclear facility

children.name: Legislative Compliance
children.description: Apply the requirements of the legislative framework (including IRR 99, associated Approved Codes or Practice, REPPIR, HAS regulations etc) to the provision of dosimetry solutions

children.name: Task Analysis
children.description: Analyse tasks important to safety in order to determine demands on personnel in terms of perception, decision making and action

children.name: Human Reliability
children.description: Carry out risk assessments in order to identify and analyse human actions or omissions that might impact on safety

children.name: Administrative controls and procedures
children.description: Identify administrative controls required to ensure that operations remain within the safe operating envelope

children.name: Personnel Competence
children.description: Apply a systematic approach to the identification and delivery of personnel competence

children.name: Workspaces
children.description: Design or specify workspaces in which plant operations and maintenance are conducted in order to ensure reliable task performance, by taking account of human perceptual and physical characteristics and the impact of environmental factors

children.name: User Interfaces
children.description: Design or specify the user interfaces, comprising controls, indications, recording instrumentation and alarms that are to be provided at appropriate locations and that are suitable and sufficient to support effective monitoring and control of the plant during all plant states

children.name: Safety Actions
children.description: Identify in a systematic way human actions that can impact on safety and when designing new systems, substantiate the allocation of safety actions between humans and technology in order to minimise the dependence on human action for maintaining safe state

children.name: Human Factors Integration
children.description: Integrate human factors into the design, assessment and management of systems throughout the entire facility life-cycle
